inn1.comm: Over the wicket, angling down leg, hint of swing, but that was just a loosener. Tamim tries to flick it but can't make contact. Slight appeal but that was going down leg.
Starting from off this time. Again, not much swing. Tamim drives but can't get the timing right. Mistimed to mid-off
Slightly wide outside off, back of a length that time. Left alone
82.1mph, good length this time, starting on off but ball not moving much yet. Tamim drives confidently but straight to Andrew Symonds at cover
This time on middle, fuller and Tamim doesn't hold back, goes for the drive and gets it past the bowler but Brad Hogg dives full length from mid-on and stops it. Keeps the batsmen down to a single
Back of a length and outside off, not that short but Nafees decides to go. Tries the pull but can't make contact. Bangladesh's openers have the energy about them. No fear, let's go
On the spot straight away. How does he do it? We've wondered that for many years. Left alone by Tamim.

Oh! Back of a length and probing on off. Tamim pushes his front foot forward and watches as the ball clips the pad and goes through to the wicketkeeper. Caught in two minds there. McGrath thinks of an appeal but stops. Fine ball
Tamim tries to let loose. Back of a length but he's down the ground straight away. Meets the ball at a good length and lets rip a slash, can't find the gap and straight to cover.
Hmm. Reckless or audacious? Down the ground again, starts too soon. Swings the bat and can't make contact. It's a good length ball outside off and Tamim missis it by a country mile
yorker. That was homing in on middle and leg. Tamim digs it out.
slightly short from McGrath this time. Tamim gets on the back foot and clips it to the leg side for a quick single. Good start from McGrath
Full ball outside off, Tamim cover-drives but can't pierce the field again, slightly wide of cover and they manage a single
wide of off and back of a length, Shahriar has all the time to stay back and glide it to third man for a single
Back of a length, he tries to tip it to the off side and take off for a single. Woudl have been dangerous. Sent back

Got 'em. Bracken takes the pace off the ball and drops it at a good length. Tamim on his knees and thinking of the slog sweep. Then he realises it's too wide and decides to go with the slap over the bowler's head. Can't get the timing yet again and only manages a tame catch to Brad Hogg at mid-off. One down.

Fine start, confident push down the ground. Classy start from Aftab. Full ball on off and he's balanced all the way, caressing it down the ground for three. Outfield expectedly slow. Hogg chases it down.
Short ball and it's Nafees's chance to charge down the wicket. Gilchrist standing back this time. Nafees takes a massive swipe and misses. He seems to be missing his opening partner Tamim.
Back of a length and outside off. On the money. Aftab pushes it to cover. Sensible so far but is it just a matter of time?
Straight and back of a length again. That McGrath length. Aftab gets a thick inside edge while trying to defend. The ball trickles to the leg side as they complete a single

Touche! 132.3mph. That's No.55 for GD McGrath, equalling Wasim Akram's record for the most World Cup dismissals. Yorker homing in on middle stump. Too quick for Shahriar and was nailed all ends up. Plays all over it and loses his off stump. GD McGrath, take a bow!
Has Halley's comet struck? A wide way down leg side from Mcgrath. Gilchrist dives full length and collects it.
Rising bouncer this time. Left alone from Saqibul
yorker length outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length and on the money. No Halley's comet, after all. Driven off the back foot to cover
Poor start. 146mph but full and swinging outside leg. Wide called. But he can pose a real threat with his pace
Toe crusher this time. Swinging in from middle and into the block-hole for Aftab. He loses his balance after being hit on his feet. That was a scorcher
Take that as a response. Back of a length and again drifting into leg, Aftab whips it in style and it races away behind square for a four. Now that's what I call a retort.
Again, this time full and straight. Aftab swishes it over the infield. The outfield is desperately slow and they can only get three. That deserved more. It's not slogging but all correct cricket.
Saqibul joins the party. Short and wide outside off, Nafees swings hard, real hard. It flies off the thickish edge and steeples to the third man fence. Bounces on the rope. Maximum
Short ball. 152mph. Better directed this time. Saqibul on the back foot and gets behind the line. Drops it close to his body. Good technique there.
Full and wide, has a go at it. They are going for them now, they have to. Races to third man for a single
Back of a length and straight. Defended confidently back to the bowler.
Straighter and drifting down leg, Saqibul flicks it for a single behind square leg

Catch! You beauty! Back of a length on off, Aftab down the track and tries to drive over mid-off but can't get the timing. Just like Tamim. It appears to have the elevation to beat mid-off but, Oh, look who's there. Nathan Bracken times his jump perfectly and latches on to the ball while in mid-air. You specy! McGrath becomes the highest wicket-taker in World Cups. Take a bow, again.

How cute was that? Good length outside off, Ashraful moves across the off stump, takes a walk almost, and tries to cutely scoop it to fine leg. No timing, no placement. It goes way in the air, before landing just short of a forward running backward square leg. Reckless? You bet
driven straight to cover. Saqibul seems to be playing this sensibly but that's exactly what we said about Aftab and Shahriar.
Defended on the back foot towards short midwicket
Full and angling down leg. Ashraful again tries the sweep-paddle-scoop shot. He's come in with a plan but it's proving a bit risky at the moment.
Straight and full and Ashraful meets it with the full face of the bat. For the first time in his innings. Driven crisply to mid-on. No run, though.
Tait down leg again. He's not got his direction right. Speedy though. Ashraful swings but can't make contact
Full and outside off, well played by Ashraful, driven wide of mid-off for a quick single.
Seven fielders on the off and Tait bowls it full on leg. Saqib only needs to clip it off his pads for an easy two. That was slightly behind square
Quick again, back of a length and outside off, punched off the back foot to cover

Wide of off, Saqib gets the room to swish and he goes for it but can't make contact. Tait is racy here. He's bowling at around 150kph, and not mph as I had mentioned earlier. Now that would be unreal.
Short ball, goes for the pull. Ball gets high on him, hits the top part of his bat and drops well wide of Hogg at mid-on. The second run was a tight one but Hogg was wayward with his throw
Back of a length, defended off the back foot. Man stationed in the deep for the pull
Backs away and flays. Good length ball outside off and Ashraful nonchalantly thwacks it over the off-side ring for a four. Good afternoon, Mr McGrath
Tries the paddle again but that's too wide of off and too full to go for that. He changes his shot in the last minute and taps it to the off side.
full ball, almost yorker length and Ashraful digs it out. Down the ground to mid-on

Goodbye Mr Ashraful. Slow delivery from the master. Good length on off and tempting, very tempting. Ashraful makes room again and tries to clear mid-on but is deceived by the pace. Ball soars high in the air, Ponting back-peddles and takes a well-judged catch. McGrath's spell reads 3.5-0-9-3. Bread and butter for Pidge
Full and slow again, nice testing delivery. Saqibul pushes tamely to the cover.
Full length on off, Habibul Basher defends it to cover.
wide of the stumps this time, Basher goes for a tame cut but can't make contact.
full ball on off, tapped to the off side. Good start from Watson
Full and slightly slow. 71mph Driven confidently between the cover fielders for a brace
Full and swinging in. Basher tries to flick it but it's a bit too quick. Gets an inside edge and goes on to deflect off the pads. Watson gets excited with an appeal but that seemed to hit the bat
defended off the front foot, thick inside edge that almost went back onto the stumps. Habibul didn't have much clue about that
Full ball on middle, sweeps straight to the fielder at backward square leg
driven off the back foot, straight to cover
beaten this time. Throws it out wide, inviting the cut. Bounces too much for him.
Ugly looking sweep but they mange a single in front of square
quicker one, dropped slightly short and outside off, Basher goes for the pull but straight to short midwicket
tapped to short cover and scamper a quick single. Symonds is prowling there but he can't cut off the run
pushed to midwicket
short ball, pulled away to deep backward square leg for a single
straight and back of a length, cut off the back foot but straight to cover
Short and cut away to point for a single
pushed down the ground
Flighted and straight, Saqib sweeps it away well to deep square leg
pushed to long-on
comes down the track and drives to long-on
waits for the ball, opens the face of the bat and runs it to short third man
short and wide, forced away to deep point
driven to cover for a single
punched down to mid-on
full and straight, spin in tandem now. Flicked to midwicket, Hodge moves across and cuts it off very well
punched to mid-on. Easily done
Bit quicker, straight too, Saqibul pushes it to mid-on for another single

Quick and fired down leg side, Basher almost overbalances and Gilchrist collects it well and snaps off the bails. Fine work there. Appeal goes up for a stumping but the umpire is calling a wide. No need for the third umpire
punched down to mid-on, Hodge again cuts it off
lofted over cover for a single
full and outside off, punched to mid-off
Full toss, that didn't come out well but Saqib can't get the timing right. Sweeps it straight to deep square for a single. It was predemidated and he didn't expect the full toss
dropped dlightly short and Basher rocks back and cuts it away to deep point
Gives it a bit of air, Saqib down the track and drives but straight back to the bowler. The two Australian spinners are doing a good job here
Starts off with a 145kph. Full and straight. Driven down the ground by Basher, back to the bowler

Slowly cranking it up. Full again and starting outside off and swinging in. Basher goes for the drive but an inside edge richochets off his pads and trickles to the off side. They scamper a quick single
Gives himself room and slaps it to cover. Tait keeping it full and straight. He's getting a hint of swing as well. Better start to his second spell than his first
Similar delivery, Basher goes across the line but again gets an inside edge that deviates off the pads to third man. Single again
This is a good length and line. Gettiing pacier by the ball. Driven to cover by Saqib but can't pierce the field.
Right in the blockhole this time. Saqib gives himself room but only digs it out and drives down the ground to long-off for a single. Good return for Tait
Saw him charging down the track and held it back. Saqib was forced to tap it to the off side and complete a single

dropped. Dipping full toss and Basher down the ground and tries to loft it over the fielder. Can't get the timing and hits it straight back. Hogg goes for the return catch but muffs it after getting his hand to it. Not the easiest of catches but Hogg is usually good off his own bowling
Second full toss of the over, Saqib sweeps it away for a single
down the track and driven back to the bowler
Full and straight again. You miss, I hit, he seems to be saying. Saqib makes room and slashes it to cover, can't beat the field.

Nailed 'em. Wide and full of off stump, 90mph. Saqib goes for the drive but can only get a thick edge. Easy take by Gilchrist behind the stumps. Not Tait's best delivery today but as it happens, produces a wicket. He's come back well in the second spell.

Full, almost yorker length. Digs it out towards midwicket and takes of for a single. Sent back by his non-striker. Ponting swoops down and goes for the direct hit. Had it hit, it would have been all over. Luckily for him, Ponting misses.
Slightly wide but full. Mashrafe makes room and goes for the swat. Too fast for him, though. He's not going to be hanging around.
clipped away a full one to midwicket for a single.
That's the Tait we saw in the first spell. Way down the leg side and giving Gilchrist a big challenge.
Good swing that time. Full and outside off. Basher makes room but can't make contact. Bangladesh's batsmen trying to make too much room. Missing regularly. Last four overs have produced just 13 runs.
Another full toss. This time a high one. Mashrafe pulls it away to deep square for a single. None of the full tosses have been given the treatment they deserved
down the ground, lofted to extra cover for a single
Driven forcefully down the ground. That was a quick, full ball. McGrath mis-fields but he recovers quickly to keep them down to one.
wrong one from Hogg. Swept but can only manage the top edge to fine leg. Complete a handy couple
Basher down the ground and drives back to the bowler
Driven to extra cover as they complete a quick single
Another full toss. Probably the outfield still slightly soggy, preventing the bowlers from gripping it. Maybe, it's a plan. Driven down the ground for a single
Full and angling into leg stump, flicked away for a single to square leg
Slow ball, angling into middle. Basher tries to go across the line but is deceived by the change of pace and gets an inside edge, onto his pads and gets a single
Full ball on middle, Mashrafe backs away and thumps it to wide long-off for a single. Can't get the elevation because it's so full
Basher down the ground and meets the ball on the full. ball flies off the thick edge to cover for a single
Slower delivery again, angling into his pads, cracked away to the leg side for a single. Run-a-ball over that
Short ball and straight but Mortaza thwacks it. He backs away to the leg side and is followed by Mcgrath but Mortaza pulls it forcefull to the vacant midwicket region for a four. Fine shot
slow this time, outside off. Mashrafe goes for the mighty hoick but an inside edge runs away behind square for a single
yorker this time, homing in on off. Basher digs it out back to the bolwer. Short, slower, yorker. That's variety for you.
back of a length, Basher down the ground trying for the loft but misses.
Straight and full. Punched away from the crease, wide of mid-on for a single
full ball again. Can't do much with that. Mashrafe drills it to long-off for a single.
Another full toss. Is this some plan? It must be. Mashrafe can't get hold of it and the thick edge flies to extra cover. Doesn't carry and they take a single
backed away, Symonds drops it short and hoicks it for a single to midwicket
Loft. Straight and full, in the slot. Mashrafe lines it up and whistles it way over the bowler for a six. That's brought the crowd to their feet. Clean strike
punched down the long-on
worked away on the leg side
backs away, full and fast outside off, swings and misses. Gilchrist laps it up low
Around the wicket, full but too wide down leg. Basher tries to work it away but it's too far away

Another slower ball does the trick. Bracken rolls his fingers over that one and drops it slightly short outside off. Basher pulls it feebly but can't beat Ricky Ponting at short midwicket. Easily done.
Slower ball outside off, Rahim can't make contact as he tries to cut
backs away and punches it away behind point
Full ball, angling on leg. Mashrafe backs away and goes for the mighty loft. Thick inside edge races past Gilchrist. Fine leg is up so that has Four written all over it
backed away, full again and the inside edge trickles to Gilchrist's left.
Finishes with a slower one. Single to cover to end the innings.

inn2.comm: Starts round the wicket straight away. Full ball on off, flicked away to short midwicket
full length ball, outside off. left alone by Gilchrist
back of a length, Gilchrist on the front foot and crisply drives it to cover. Can't find the gap, straight to the fielder
back of a length and outside off, Gilchrist on the back foot and square driven again, finds the gap this time and picks up an easy three
Fine ball, back of a length and on off, moves away after pitching. Hayden gets an edge that drops well short of first slip. Mis-field allows them to complete a single
punched wide of mid-off for an easy single.

Over the wicket, angling it away from Gilchrist. On the front foot and eased away through extra cover. The outfield is slow but the shot has enough timing to fetch four. The cover fielder is a bit too late to reach it
Full ball on off, not much swing, though. Gilchrist drives straight to cover.

Dropped. Superb ball from Baisya. Pitched back of a length on off and moved away fter pitching. Gilchrist doesn't move his feet and gets an edge, ball flies to the wicketkeeper's left. He is going the wrong away initially and can't make ground to pick up the low chance. Races away for four
Another edge but this time it's wide of the slip. Single that time
square driven confidently for a single
back of a length and angling away. Gilchrist watches it before deciding to leave it alone. Good over but it cost 10.
round the wicket again, well outside off and good bounce. Hayden flashes but can't make contact.
Slightly straighter, similar back of a length, Hayden cuts but straight to point.
A Hayden special. Walking down the pitch with an air of arrogance and slaps it between point and cover for a crackling four. Good ball, made to look ordinary
Straighter, good length from Mortaza. Hayden defends it back to the bowler
walks down the track again but is cramped for room this time. Tucked in front of square for a single
Back of a length, defended to the off side
driven to the off side for a single
too wayward this time, down the leg side and full. Gilchrist turns it away past the keeper for four. Fine leg inside the circle. Poor line
Drilled down the ground crisply. Too full and outside off, Gilchrist on the front foot and cracks it past mid-off for a glorious four
slightly slower, straighter too. Gilchrist watches it carefully and punishes it past the bowler for another four. Ripper!
Back of a length and outside off, not much room for Gilchrist and he is slightly cramped for space as he tries to cut. Drops down the pitch and the bowler cleans up
full again and struck to mid-off. The fielder is at the edge of the circle so they complete an easy single

Too straight, drifting down leg. Fine leg is up and Mortaza angles down leg. Gilchrist just needs to turn it efficiently, past the fielder for another four. He's motoring along now. An early shower beckons
Straighter, better length too. Gilchrist on the back foot and defends down the ground
on the short side and Gilchrist steers it off the back foot to third man
good length, down the leg side again but Hayden can't get it past the short fine leg
walks down the ground again but it's a straight ball. Turned away in front of square for a single
slower ball, full and on off. Gilchrist pats it back down the ground back to the bowler
full and outside off, Hayden shoulders arms
Full on off, moving away slightly. Hayden tries to push it through mid-on but gets a thick edge past the slip. Batmsen run hard and complete a good brace
short of a length, Hayden doesn't have much room but manages a cut nevertheless. Past the cover field for two
That's a scorcher down the ground. Hayden picks it up from a good length and lofts if way over mid-on for a six. Clean hit. Hayden can be brutal with those

full toss. Hayden pushes it to mid-off and completes a quick single. Tapash Baisya seems to have pulled a muscle there. He's in trouble. Hayden goes up to him and enquires what's wrong. He appears in some trouble. Second casualty of the match, after Shane Watson earlier left the field with a calf strain?
back of a length outside off stump, punched off the back foot towards mid-off for a single
back of a length on off stump, he gets behind the line and pushes back to Mortaza
short and Gilchrist stands and unleashes a pull, deep square leg comes around to midwicket and keeps them to a single
slightly short, Hayden on the frotn foot but it's rising on him. Punched away to the cover fielder
Again tries a walk down the pitch but stops after one step, tapped to the off side for a quick single
Slghtly slow ball, angling in on middle, Gilchrist reads it well and taps it to mid-on for a single.
Backs away and tries to swivel around to pull it but can't get the timing. The ball goes to deep square leg as the batsmen complete a single
Quick through the air, outside off, beating Hayden with pace.
patted back to the bowler, flat and quick again
driven to cover off the front foot. Razzak not giving Hayden much room
Drifing down leg, Hayden turns it to short midwicket and takes off. Direct hit would have been out but Hayden survives
short and outside off, driven off the back foot to cover
quicker ball but Gilchrist reads it well, it's outside off and he rocks back to aquare drive crisply. The slow outfield keeps them to two but it deserved four. Good ball, better shot
Round the wicket and straight. Hayden pushes it to the off side but can't manage a single
good length ball, too straight. Hayden whips it off his pads for a single
Fine ball that. Straight and full. Gilchrist goes back and pushes it down the ground. Had he missed, that was plumb
patted back to the bowler
on the back foot again, tapped to mid-off
drops it a bit short, cut away square for a quick single
Razzak over the wicket. Fired in at a good length. Gilchrist pushes it back to the bowler
slightly short and angling into the pads, tucked away in front of square and the batsmen manage two by the time the fielder gets around
quick ball, square driven and scampers a single
slightly slower this time, flighted outside off and fuller, Hayden slog sweeps it crisply over midwicket for a forceful four. When he hits them ... you know the rest
back foot punch down the ground
Flighted it straight, Gilchrist down the ground and powers it to the right of cover. The ball is timed well and gets past the slow outfield for another four
tapped down the ground off the back foot. Rafique drops it slightly short this time
Gives himself room but can't get the timing to blitz it past cover. Finds the fielder and decides against the single
Good loop from over the wicket this time. Pitches on leg and Hayden pushes straight to the short fine leg
down the ground, flicked away behind square for a single
slightly short and angling down leg, Gilchrist turns it to the vacant short midwicket region. Seven off the over. Too easy now.
Full and on off, driven straight to cover. Crisp shot, though
Quicker ball, Gilchrist down the track and punches it through mid-on for a single
Down the ground but it's held back well by Razzak. He saw Hayden coming there. It's glided straight to third man
Full and straight, Hayden pushes it back to the bowler

good length ball outside off, Hayden down the ground and tries to loft it over long-on, beaten in the flight but gets a thickish edge that speeds away to the midwicket fence. Such is the power he generates
on the back foot to a quick one, patted back to the bowler
Flighted outside off, Gilchrist down the ground in a flash, clatters it over extra cover with a pendulum smooth swing. Man at long-ff but he can't reach that. Way over for a six.
driven down the long-on for a single
punched back to the bowler
down the ground again, ball speared in on leg and Hayden on-drives it for a single
quick and short, slightly wide as well and all that Gilchrist needs to do is rock back and back-cut it between short third man and point. It was in the air but in the gap. No chance for either men
driven to cover. Full ball from Rafique this time
Round the wicket from Razzaq. Straight and full, pushed down the ground
That's a biggie! Hayden charges down the ground, meets the ball on a half-volley and lofts it straight way, way back into the stands. It was muscled that one and Hayden can beef them spectacularly
punched to cover for a single
It's all over. Slog swept way over midwicket this time. He can be dynamite this man. Matt the Bat finishes it in style.
